commit_message:
Skip gate FS optimization if no secondary disk

This commit removes the assumption that all gate nodes have a secondary
disk, and skip tuning the filesystem if the node doesn't have one.

This fixes gate failures on OVH nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1525047

Change-Id: Ief22f34b32caf7a8b446df888fc5cc1964ad272e
(cherry picked from commit 40b8a0243e20d551f2e153759f531749783656be)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/35/268835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Only do FS optimization if we have a secondary disk if [[ -b /dev/${DEV} ]]; then # The reason for using BTRFS is stability. There are numerous issues with the # devicemapper backed on Ubuntu and AUFS is slow. BTRFS is very solid as a # backend in my experince. I use ie almost exclusively. # Format Disks and setup Docker to use BTRFS sudo umount /dev/${DEV} || true sudo parted /dev/${DEV} -s -- mklabel msdos sudo service docker stop echo 'DOCKER_OPTS="-s btrfs"' | sudo tee /etc/default/docker sudo rm -rf /var/lib/docker/* # We want to snapshot the entire docker directory so we have to first create a # subvolume and use that as the root for the docker directory. sudo mkfs.btrfs -f /dev/${DEV} sudo mount /dev/${DEV} /var/lib/docker sudo btrfs subvolume create /var/lib/docker/docker sudo umount /var/lib/docker sudo mount -o noatime,compress=lzo,space_cache,subvol=docker /dev/${DEV} /var/lib/docker sudo service docker start fi
deleted_lines: # The reason for using BTRFS is stability. There are numerous issues with the # devicemapper backed on Ubuntu and AUFS is slow. BTRFS is very solid as a # backend in my experince. I use ie almost exclusively. # Format Disks and setup Docker to use BTRFS sudo umount /dev/${DEV} || true sudo parted /dev/${DEV} -s -- mklabel msdos sudo service docker stop echo 'DOCKER_OPTS="-s btrfs"' | sudo tee /etc/default/docker sudo rm -rf /var/lib/docker/* # We want to snapshot the entire docker directory so we have to first create a # subvolume and use that as the root for the docker directory. sudo mkfs.btrfs -f /dev/${DEV} sudo mount /dev/${DEV} /var/lib/docker sudo btrfs subvolume create /var/lib/docker/docker sudo umount /var/lib/docker sudo mount -o noatime,compress=lzo,space_cache,subvol=docker /dev/${DEV} /var/lib/docker sudo service docker start

commit_message:
Adds rally support

Rally is a benchmarking tool that can help to measure how new code
changes affect performance, and can permit us to detect performance
and scaling issues

Closes-Bug: #1526148
Change-Id: Ic52c7ae37dcf2a5be29e40851d8216d48d9ce9de
Signed-off-by: A Ojea <itsuugo@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Instance creation fails with the new V2 driver

This patch fixes an issue with the V2 driver where neutron validation
will fail for security groups when trying to start an instance.
This is due to the modification of the port's context that leads to an
evaluation error in Neutron's RPC notifier.

Change-Id: Ic148b73c0ff1d940ac19f3aac298141344888ea7
Closes-bug: #1533803
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/20/267120/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import copy new_context = copy.deepcopy(context.current) new_context['security_groups'] = groups new_context['tenant_id'] = tenant_id context.current['id'], 'create', new_context) new_context = copy.deepcopy(context.current) new_context['security_groups'] = groups new_context['network_id'] = port['network_id'] context.current['id'], 'update', new_context)
deleted_lines: context.current['security_groups'] = groups context.current['tenant_id'] = tenant_id context.current['id'], 'create', context.current) context.current['security_groups'] = groups context.current['network_id'] = port['network_id'] context.current['id'], 'update', context.current)

commit_message:
remove option verbose from config files

Option "verbose" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated for removal.
Its value may be silently ignored in the future.

If this option is not set explicitly, there is no such warning.
Furthermore, the default value of verbose is true, so there is
no need to set this value in config files.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I3ec2a8900c984a64bc0645672ef89a63975f7f4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/42/269042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Rename bootstrap.sh to centos-bootstrap.sh

Since Ubuntu and Centos are both valid options it's better
to list their names in both bootstrap files

Trivial-fix

Change-Id: Ie8179403ba550ff61a45aa936fb87e02b9f74861

commit_message:
Fix validation of server personality property

During validation, the software config content will not be
available via get_attr function. Hence we will end up calling
encode on a NoneType object.

Try to encode to utf-8 only if content is available.

Change-Id: I3e7dc4a9fcbd95482df880a7454fa5a09d6af68f
Closes-Bug: #1528463
(cherry picked from commit 054f6807398eae4625c0b639837c979cdaf299e3)

added_lines: commit d898a3d30e89eded72ca6bfa51c0b567e6f3055c (HEAD, puppet-tests/review/oleg_gelbukh/bp/partition-preservation, review/oleg_gelbukh/bp/partition-preservation)index 3281415..19ce2b5 100644@@ -1,8 +1,28 @@ + exec { 'udevadm trigger': + command => 'udevadm trigger', + returns => 0, + logoutput => true, + } -> + + exec {'ceph-disk activate-all': + command => 'ceph-disk activate-all', + returns => 0, + logoutput => true, + } -> + firewall { '011 ceph-osd allow': chain => 'INPUT', dport => '6800-7100', @@ -11,5 +31,4 @@ class ceph::osds ( } -> ceph::osds::osd{ $devices: } - }index b4b7c1b..d04d47f 100644@@ -5,9 +5,11 @@ describe 'ceph::osds', :type => :class do context 'Simple ceph::osds class test' do let (:params) {{ :devices => ['/dev/vdc', '/dev/vdd' ] }} - it { should contain_firewall('011 ceph-osd allow') } - it { should contain_ceph__osds__osd('/dev/vdc') } - it { should contain_ceph__osds__osd('/dev/vdd') } + it { should contain_exec('udevadm trigger') } + it { should contain_exec('ceph-disk activate-all').that_requires('Exec[udevadm trigger]') } + it { should contain_firewall('011 ceph-osd allow').that_requires('Exec[ceph-disk activate-all]') } + it { should contain_ceph__osds__osd('/dev/vdc').that_requires('Firewall[011 ceph-osd allow]') } + it { should contain_ceph__osds__osd('/dev/vdd').that_requires('Firewall[011 ceph-osd allow]') } end @@ -19,7 +21,7 @@ describe 'ceph::osds', :type => :class do

commit_message:
Automatically generate etc/orchestrator.ini file

This switches keystone to use oslo-config-generator, where the contents
of our sample configuration file are configured using a configuration
file in etc/oslo-config-generator.

Also fix some config problems.

blueprint autogen-astara-conf-file

Change-Id: I394805b18eecc4fbc583f9d64d34b8e95b55a845

commit_message:
gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional fails with 300 response code

Novaclient's functional test will try to authenticate against v1.0 auth
service when auth_url didn't contain version in cloud.yaml. Keystone
will response 300 status code. Novaclient wouldn't handle such status
code yet, therefore gate will fails with 300 response code.

The requested resource will contain multiple version links. We should
select v2.0 version.

Change-Id: I2b4fba4f87e3b3ccc0ecac1587a8b307b1129770
Related-Bug: 1506103
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/50/235850/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif resp.status_code == 300: for version_value in body.get('versions', {}).get('values', []): if version_value.get('id') == 'v2.0': for link in version_value.get('links', []): if link.get('rel') == 'self' and 'href' in link: return link['href'] raise exceptions.from_response(resp, body, url)

commit_message:
Cache agent clean steps on node

In order to make getting clean/zap steps a synchronous call, instead of
one that blocks on communication with the agent, the agent clean steps
should be cached to the node object. Any time cleaning is started, the
steps will be fetched from the agent and cached.

Deprecates ilo.clean_priority_erase_devices, as we can use just use
agent.agent_erase_devices_priority, instead of having two config
options that do the exact same thing.

Partial-implements blueprint: implement-zapping-states

Change-Id: I0ef5369f0a14c27ccd8bb09bf3835f86b8aba018

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 22:10:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/bd42174bfcbe9168437ddf787da3f12ebae071ca', 'message': "Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

commit_message:
Make minimum default num_engine_workers>=4

Downstream test environments are frequently having failing stacks with
error messages like:

  MessagingTimeout: resources[0]: Timed out waiting for a reply to
  message ID ...

These environments generally have 1 or 2 cores, so only spawn one or two
engine workers. This deadlocks with stacks that have many nested stacks
due to engine->engine RPC calls.

Even our own functional tests don't work reliably with less than 4
workers, and the workaround has been to set that explicitly in
pre_test_hook.sh.

This change sets the default minimum number of workers to 4, but still
matches workers to cores for larger servers.

This change also moves the default evaluation to heat.cmd.engine so that
generated configuration doesn't get a inappropriate default value.

Change-Id: I99eb0ffec0626607ad5085a55ec4291881a1ed0e
Closes-Bug: #1526045
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/93/266593/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the get_events method

The get_events method is very large - almost 140 lines
(in ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py).

I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of get_events.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: I23d0dea303826a2d49e3612be765e4de64178897
Closes-Bug: #1512755

subject: Ignore driver pause operation during live migrate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 21:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/bd254662edaeaf288df704f476d6825981983f2f', 'message': "Ignore driver pause operation during live migrate

The pause-vm-during-live_migration blueprint implements
a new nova api that allows a user to sepcify that they want
to force a live migration to finish.  This api call is
translated to the compute driver's pause operation.
PowerVM does not support pausing a VM. Since we don't want
the api or pause to fail we'll just ignore it while the VM
is migrating.  PowerVM already has logic to limit the length
of a live migration.

blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration

Change-Id: Ib6a6d30e9cfd3f97d4e0c9ee26ea6a16062aca13
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore driver pause operation during live migrate

The pause-vm-during-live_migration blueprint implements
a new nova api that allows a user to sepcify that they want
to force a live migration to finish.  This api call is
translated to the compute driver's pause operation.
PowerVM does not support pausing a VM. Since we don't want
the api or pause to fail we'll just ignore it while the VM
is migrating.  PowerVM already has logic to limit the length
of a live migration.

blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration

Change-Id: Ib6a6d30e9cfd3f97d4e0c9ee26ea6a16062aca13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/48/266048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_pause(self): """Validates the virt driver 'pause' operation.""" inst = objects.Instance(**powervm.TEST_INSTANCE) inst.task_state = None # Normal case of the 'pause' operation self.assertRaises(NotImplementedError, self.drv.pause, inst) # Pause during live migration inst.task_state = task_states.MIGRATING # It should just run and return nothing... self.assertIsNone(self.drv.pause(inst)) # The task state wasn't change to 'paused' or anything... self.assertEqual(inst.task_state, task_states.MIGRATING)

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded DEPLOYWAIT timeout from Baremetal Scenario

Currently the baremetal scenario is hardcoded to wait 15 seconds
for the ironic node to reach the wait-callback state. This patch
uses a configuration option in place of this hardcoded value.

Closes-Bug: #1526466
Change-Id: I8cded9467dc03d9e1a75222bb4b017604ae946af

commit_message:
Enable keystone handling of X-Forwarded-Proto header

If the X-Forwarded-Proto header is received by keystone, this option
will make the service properly handle it. This is useful, for instance,
if TLS is enabled for the admin endpoint.

Change-Id: I31a1f51591e8423367e61eafc3af9b2d61278468

commit_message:
Pass environment variables of proxy to tox

When a development environment is under a proxy, tox is failed even if
environment variables of the proxy are set.
This patch fixes this problem.
See Also: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191600

Change-Id: Ibb86bca3d3e11197301629be15fdcedd46761dd3
Closes-bug: #1465086

commit_message:
Merge pep8 and bandit test environments

Instead of starting two virtual machines for two different lint like
tests, merge all lint like tests into a single environment. The new
environment is called "linters" to make the purpose of it clearer.

We need to keep the separate pep8 and bandit environments to not break
the CI jobs, those can only be removed in the future.

Needed-By: Id7820a8fe188c4de3ba94916e07fd54b7bb4e6fd
Change-Id: Ibcbe9b5c3ae413eae82f1fec0be13e7a50cb1a51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/93/261993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py34,py27,linters,docs,genconfig,releasenotes[testenv:linters] # General environment for lint like jobs, it includes the # pep8 and bandit environments. deps = .[bandit] {[testenv]deps} commands = flake8 {posargs} # Run bash8 during pep8 runs to ensure violations are caught by # the check and gate queues bashate examples/pki/gen_pki.sh # Check that .po and .pot files are valid. bash -c "find keystone -type f -regex '.*\.pot?' -print0| \ xargs -0 -n 1 msgfmt --check-format -o /dev/null" # Run security linter bandit -c bandit.yaml -r keystone -n5 -p gate

subject: Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 10:54:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/tasks/galera_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/templates/my.cnf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/galera_server/handlers/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/4a401125e46ca28d3d8848ea194737f1e17f6992', 'message': 'Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes:
 - a new configuration file (part of the mariadb package) is being
   removed which has unforeseen options within it causing no logs
   to be created.
 - a mysql ping check is implemented to verify that the service is
   responding after the restart handler is fired.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265
 - https://review.openstack.org/268707

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905

Wait for galera to respond after restarts

Add a mysql ping check to verify the service is responding
after a restart handler is fired.

Change-Id: Idfc1e1a1113ab0ffa221e4c0a4cc074df23fe89a
(cherry picked from commit f6fb63f3477e7cdada1a1be8d670755a0e4e6f0b)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve MariaDB/Galera cluster startup/logging issues

This patch ensures that MariaDB is given adequate time to start on a
resources constrained system (180s versus the default of 30s),
ensures that the error log is appropriately populated and also
provides a failback restart in the case where there may be a corrupt
sst directory.

In the handler changes:
 - the environment variable "MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT" is now being
   passed into the init script because the defaults are not being
   sourced at the init script runtime.
 - the temporary "sst" directory is cleaned up should the handler
   restart fail. This ensurez that a node is in a clean state if a
   leftover sst directory was on the disk which would cause a node
   to fail to join a cluster or bootstrap.

In the task changes:
 - a new configuration file (part of the mariadb package) is being
   removed which has unforeseen options within it causing no logs
   to be created.
 - a mysql ping check is implemented to verify that the service is
   responding after the restart handler is fired.

This patch is based on:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256016
 - https://review.openstack.org/266265
 - https://review.openstack.org/268707

Closes-Bug: #1532761
Closes-Bug: #1533126
Change-Id: I16af30c660790656fc2d59f9943c172b88098905

Wait for galera to respond after restarts

Add a mysql ping check to verify the service is responding
after a restart handler is fired.

Change-Id: Idfc1e1a1113ab0ffa221e4c0a4cc074df23fe89a
(cherry picked from commit f6fb63f3477e7cdada1a1be8d670755a0e4e6f0b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/75/268975/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: environment: MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT: 180 register: galera_restart # notifies are only fired when status is "changed" changed_when: galera_restart | failed failed_when: false notify: - "remove stale .sst" - "Restart mysql fall back" - name: remove stale .sst file: path: "/var/lib/mysql/.sst" state: absent when: galera_restart | failed - name: Restart mysql fall back service: name: mysql state: restarted args: "{{ (not galera_existing_cluster | bool and inventory_hostname == groups['galera_all'][0]) | ternary('--wsrep-new-cluster', '') }}" environment: MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT: 180 when: galera_restart | failed register: galera_restart_fall_back until: galera_restart_fall_back | success retries: 3 delay: 5

commit_message:
fix project_id and user_id fields not set when create gnocchi alarm

When using command alarm-gnocchi-* the project_id and user_id are not
set. The patch fix it and add related tests:

1.ceilometer gnocchi alarm create/update test cases
2.check gnocchi alarm create/update command args test cases
3.check update alarm without alarm-id
4.check shadowed args are restored

Closes-Bug: #1506509
Change-Id: If6a8cfd9bc52b3eeff99dfcfdee2f4da7220674b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/31/250131/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_shadowed_args_gnocchi_threshold_alarm(self): cli_args = [ '--metric', 'cpu', '--threshold', '80', '--resource-type', 'instance', '--resource-id', 'fb16a05a-669d-414e-8bbe-93aa381df6a8', '--aggregation-method', 'last', ] self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-resources-' '-threshold-create', cli_args, 'create') self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-aggregation-' 'by-resources-threshold-create', cli_args, 'create') self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-aggregation-' 'by-metrics-threshold-create', cli_args, 'create') cli_args += ['--alarm_id', '437b7ed0-3733-4054-a877-e9a297b8be85'] self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-resources-' 'threshold-update', cli_args, 'create') self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-aggregation-' 'by-resources-threshold-update', cli_args, 'create') self._test_shadowed_args_alarm('alarm-gnocchi-aggregation-' 'by-metrics-threshold-update', cli_args, 'create')

commit_message:
Consolidating OpenStack playbook doc

Removed install-openstack-* files
Moved content into install-openstack.rst

Change-Id: Ib7aee81a73f76d97262465e7316eef3d84a495f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/25/268325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: `Home <index.html>`_ OpenStack-Ansible Installation Guide Running the OpenStack playbook ------------------------------ #. Change to the ``/opt/openstack-ansible/playbooks`` directory. #. Run the OpenStack setup playbook, which runs a series of sub-playbooks: .. code-block:: shell-session # openstack-ansible setup-openstack.yml The openstack-common.yml sub-playbook builds all OpenStack services from source and takes up to 30 minutes to complete. As the playbook progresses, the quantity of containers in the "polling" state will approach zero. If any operations take longer than 30 minutes to complete, the playbook will terminate with an error. .. code-block:: shell-session changed: [target_host_glance_container-f2ebdc06] changed: [target_host_heat_engine_container-36022446] changed: [target_host_neutron_agents_container-08ec00cd] changed: [target_host_heat_apis_container-4e170279] changed: [target_host_keystone_container-c6501516] changed: [target_host_neutron_server_container-94d370e5] changed: [target_host_nova_api_metadata_container-600fe8b3] changed: [target_host_nova_compute_container-7af962fe] changed: [target_host_cinder_api_container-df5d5929] changed: [target_host_cinder_volumes_container-ed58e14c] changed: [target_host_horizon_container-e68b4f66] <job 802849856578.7262> finished on target_host_heat_engine_container-36022446 <job 802849856578.7739> finished on target_host_keystone_container-c6501516 <job 802849856578.7262> finished on target_host_heat_apis_container-4e170279 <job 802849856578.7359> finished on target_host_cinder_api_container-df5d5929 <job 802849856578.7386> finished on target_host_cinder_volumes_container-ed58e14c <job 802849856578.7886> finished on target_host_horizon_container-e68b4f66 <job 802849856578.7582> finished on target_host_nova_compute_container-7af962fe <job 802849856578.7604> finished on target_host_neutron_agents_container-08ec00cd <job 802849856578.7459> finished on target_host_neutron_server_container-94d370e5 <job 802849856578.7327> finished on target_host_nova_api_metadata_container-600fe8b3 <job 802849856578.7363> finished on target_host_glance_container-f2ebdc06 <job 802849856578.7339> polling, 1675s remaining <job 802849856578.7338> polling, 1675s remaining <job 802849856578.7322> polling, 1675s remaining <job 802849856578.7319> polling, 1675s remaining Setting up the compute hosts takes up to 30 minutes to complete, particularly in environments with many compute hosts. commit_message:
[install-guide] fixed typos

Found and fixed the following typos in install-guide
: Image service services -> Image services
: missing "and"
: Memcache -> Memcached
: missing punctuation (.)
: Networking option number is "1" for Provider networks.

Change-Id: If50788a90f3c11cd65b510f243c85af48eb4499d
backport: Liberty

Bump up undercloud VM specs

specs, make undercloud VM more powerful by default.

commit_message:
Fix for sessions that point to non-existing urls

When a session is selected and then deleted, freezer-web-ui breaks by trying to
create a list of clients inside a non-existing session

Resolves bug: 1533705

Change-Id: I460c0abca746e74f2eab78694765ea941406ecf7

commit_message:
Send max retries, interval and mandatory fields

max retries, max retries interval and mandatory values are not present in
the dictionary that the api gets, this commit fix that by updating the
dictionary with those values

Resolves bug: 1533637

Change-Id: I3be163db0da7e3e84881bb6c3ab378cb1687037c

We shouldn't initialize the database by default, but this should be

commit_message:
Skip AIDE initialization by default

The AIDE database initialization consumes a lot of CPU time and I/O resources.
We shouldn't initialize the database by default, but this should be
configurable by the deployer.

Closes-bug: 1534658

Change-Id: If680000619c35914e58ed8b7883c7eaa7928cec4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/22/268222/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # By default, the AIDE database won't be initialized immediately since it can # consume plenty of CPU and I/O resources while it runs. To initialize the # AIDE database immediately when the playbook finishes, set the following # variable to 'true': initialize_aide: false

commit_message:
Get valid server state

Change host_status from EXTERNALLY_DEFINED_TO_BE_DOWN to DOWN.
Change default policy as admin_api.

APIImpact

Partially implements: blueprint get-valid-server-state

Change-Id: I67ebb9f84e202828c32e27492e272b24e25ad3a6

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ieb28867621ba4c3679cc32bb8288342d18f753c2
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Create packetary project

This project provides object model and API for dealing with deb
and rpm repositories. One can use this framework to
implement operations like building repository
from a set of packages, clone repository, find package
dependencies, mix repositories, pull out a subset of
packages into a separate repository, etc.

Change-Id: Ic4b285f6e8d6d0489b5c0ca6ca5eee2bdab0672f

commit_message:
Fix api endpoint for action retrieval

js code cannot reach the api endpoints for action retrieval in specific cases
because it depends on the actual url in the browser

Closes-bug: 1525169
Depends-On: I837e3fe973d72c792cb34711cef9f6507a004d49

Change-Id: Ibffad1a6a24559535c71ea94ba98deeb78ebeccb

commit_message:
Put ceilometer integration test on client lib

We breaks three times heat and ceilometer gating the last month
because of ceilometerclient release. That could be catched by the
ceilometer integration testing job.

So this change put this job on ceilometerclient.

Change-Id: I8892c347f278893761304caf54cdddfeb3ac7cfd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-18 16:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/ebe4f64f5c5d384c4137c78a18df404cf274efdc', 'message': 'Remove glance python34 jobs on Liberty

Python 3 in master, it is a waste of resources to run Python 3 tests

Removing Python 3 tests was proposed to not break gates when my

Change-Id: Ia4df8f05d5746887eb99bbf368d29e8d30a3a90a

commit_message:
Remove glance python34 jobs on Liberty

I made the python34 job voting on Glance to ensure that no Python 3
regression is introduced in master. Since Glance does not support
Python 3 in master, it is a waste of resources to run Python 3 tests
on Liberty.

The python34 jobs are already skipped on Kilo.

Removing Python 3 tests was proposed to not break gates when my
oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f will be
merged into oslo.context. I proposed to update Glance tests to
support this change. The Glance patch was merged in master but
rejected in Liberty: see change
Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9. The consensus was to
remove the gate instead.

commit_message:
Delete heat stack on app delete

This patch addresses the deletion of heat stack on solum
app delete. Prior to this patch, on issuing an app delete
command solum would only remove the app entries from solum
registry.

Change-Id: I2c2ffbb1aa1470ce408081c14b3635fec8543066
Closes-Bug: #1517588

commit_message:
Remove translation from repos that are not setup

This for horizon-cisco-ui, ironic-ui, trove-dashboard, zaqar-ui.

These four repositories are not setup yet for translations, the periodic (daily)
jobs fail for them and there's no effort going on to fix them.

Disable translations. Once repositories are setup we can readd.

Change-Id: I4c0242be87d290cb6758f6caacd3e514bd3a9c8c

commit_message:
Avoid git clone in integration test

Allow script to be called with a third argument which is a path to a
checked out directory. This allows setting up the repo externally using
zuul-cloner in the infra script and allows usage of depends-on.

Simplify the script a bit, we can remove the special handling for file
and also do not need to give a default argument, this is called from
tox.

Change-Id: I3b6180b6b274966de63fe281021ff9f4186a929b
Needed-By: I828c1875e5f008fa55b693ad210421794395f623

commit_message:
Drop py33 support

"Python 3.3 support is being dropped since OpenStack Liberty."
written in following URL.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

And already the infra team and the oslo team are dropping py33
support from their projects.

Since we rely on oslo for a lot of our work, and depend on infra
for our CI, we should drop py33 support too.

Change-Id: I453abf7ed4ff7ed0996bfb1578e68a791c3b40a5
Closes-Bug: #1526170
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/71/261171/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Change-Id: I555f4c94d324a292c1b8bf562c8ae74b56795803
Closes-Bug:#1512207

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.
Closes-Bug: #1268480

Change-Id: I0a318979a926b630e534fe6c76d9188640cf7ce0

commit_message:
disable voting for tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full

This job has been failing too often lately, each time with a timeout
related failures.

For example: http://logs.openstack.org/68/264068/6/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-keystone-eventlet-full/947b46b/console.html#_2016-01-17_21_42_48_600

Jobs that are passing are taking around 1h 44m, but the ones that
fail seem to be around 1h 58m.

This is impacting keystone development as approved code is
failing gate and check.

Temporarily disable voting of this job until we can identity
the cause of the slowdown and ensure it passes consistently.

Change-Id: I3f0d3718a62d7ebf093c4da80d983692b96b7dfe

mock shouldn't return global value

and affects subsequent tests.
Instead copy those dict.

commit_message:
Default values for enabling services in ceilometer

The os_ceilometer role makes use of variables for each OpenStack service
to configure notification queue listeners. Include default values
for those variables in the role's default vars.

commit_message:
Skip docker resource install with UCA packages

This change updates the heat modular task to only attempt to install the
heat docker packages when using a package set that provides a standalone
package. Currently only the RedHat and Debian based package sets provide
a seperate package. The UCA packages do not provide the heat docker
templates as a separate package.

Change-Id: If66f928f8afdebd3eedad1da9ac9e5c1e23c2101
Related-Blueprint: deploy-with-uca-packages
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/96/263396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: it 'should manage heat-docker package correctly based on OS' do if !facts.has_key?(:os_package_type) or facts[:os_package_type] != 'ubuntu' if facts[:osfamily] == 'RedHat' heat_docker_package_name = 'openstack-heat-docker' elsif facts[:osfamily] == 'Debian' heat_docker_package_name = 'heat-docker' end should contain_package('heat-docker').with( 'ensure' => 'installed', 'name' => heat_docker_package_name, 'require' => 'Package[heat-engine]') else should_not contain_package('heat-docker').with( 'ensure' => 'installed', 'require' => 'Package[heat-engine]') end
deleted_lines: it 'should install heat-docker package only after heat-engine' do should contain_package('heat-docker').with( 'ensure' => 'installed', 'require' => 'Package[heat-engine]', )

commit_message:
Removed use of deprecated LOG.warn method

LOG.warn is deprecated. We were still used it some places.
So I replaced the LOG.warn method to LOG.warning, which is not
deprecated.

Change-Id: I9461cec569445ad6c40db9ce2feeeba1ef0af0e3
Closes-Bug: #1508442

commit_message:
Deprecate memcache as token persistence backend

Memcache as token persistence backend is not designed for HA and slower
than memcache_pool.

Change-Id: I9c112eb2d1f50ef4c248c84436a2ee33a3f6f114
Closes-bug: 1436324

commit_message:
Add python-brick-cinderclient-ext project to Cinder

The python-brick-cinderclient-ext project has been created as an
extension to python-cinderclient for performing local storage
management operations independent of Nova. This patch adds the
new project to the list of Cinder projects.

Change-Id: Ibcc4c5da26aaeee99898a7c5c5e5ef1be6517029
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats refs/changes/93/268793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-17 18:57:21.000000000', 'files': ['reviewstats/cmd/reviewers.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats/commit/e33cf702a104a8e83bc3174ec755e1980b121ffd', 'message': "Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers

The list of core team members was being retrieved for every review
for each patchset. The utils.get_core_team does some caching to make
sure an API call wasn't made for each of these calls, but since the
project never changes for the review we can save a few cycles by not
making the call if it's not necessary.

This moves the retrieval of the core list before the loop through
reviews to make sure it's only called once per patchset.

Change-Id: Iac9f3b6eb71131eccce58a60656865eeb77b8fda
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize core list retrieval in reviewers

The list of core team members was being retrieved for every review
for each patchset. The utils.get_core_team does some caching to make
sure an API call wasn't made for each of these calls, but since the
project never changes for the review we can save a few cycles by not
making the call if it's not necessary.

This moves the retrieval of the core list before the loop through
reviews to make sure it's only called once per patchset.

Change-Id: Iac9f3b6eb71131eccce58a60656865eeb77b8fda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reviewstats refs/changes/99/268799/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: core_team = utils.get_core_team(project, options.server, options.user, options.password)

commit_message:
Blueprint deprecating setting secret content type in client

Manually setting the content type for storing a secret has already
been marked as deprecated. However, it is still possible to utilize
the feature. This blueprint proposes full deprecation of the feature
and refactoring the tests in the barbican client.

Change-Id: I3695b9b58839b2fb838afe0fee7659913eb59e04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/45/248845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Deprecate Setting Secret Content Type in Barbican Client ======================================================== This blueprint proposes that the barbican client no longer offers the user the availability to specify the payload_content_type or payload_content_encoding when storing a secret. The reason this is being proposed in a blueprint is for transparency of the deprecation and because of the magnitude of the code refactoring. Problem Description =================== Specifying the payload content type and payload content encoding can lead to problematic outcomes. 2 bugs have already been opened displaying the problems that can occur when a user utilizes these parameters. 1. `Bug 1419166 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-barbicanclient/+bug/1419166>`_ 2. `Bug 1504646 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-barbicanclient/+bug/1504646>`_ The first bug displays that when a user retrieves a secret, they might not get back the secret they stored. The second displays that when a user specifies to store a secret in base64 encoding, it becomes impossible to retrieve the secret through the CLI. It has been brought up before that this feature should be deprecated in the client. The feature has been already marked as deprecated in the first bug. However, it is still possible to use the feature due to backwards compatibility. A new user to Barbican might not be aware the feature should not be used. Moreover, the longer the feature resides in the client the more tests will need to be rewritten. After removing the feature there were 92 errors and 1 failure when running the functional tests. This means all those tests need to be refactored to accommodate the deprecation. Letting the feature linger within the client will only increase the number of tests that will most likely need to be rewritten. Since the client has been recently integrated with the openstack client now would be the best time to deprecate if before it becomes a nuisance for new users. Removing this feature makes the client much easier to use. The client is already set to determine how to store the secret based on user input. This was added when the first bug was resolved. Proposed Change =============== The CLI should no longer offer the 'payload-content-type' and 'payload-content-encoding' flags when storing a secret. Since they will not be used when storing a secret they should also be removed when getting a secret. The attributes will also become read-only. This prevents the user from manually setting them when using the client. The tests will also need to be rewritten. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- It might be nice to notify a user that the feature has been deprecated when a user tries to manually set the attributes. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: TBD Other assignees: TBD Work Items ---------- 1. Remove payload-content-type option from 'barbican secret store' command 2. Remove payload-content-encoding option from 'barbican secret store' command 3. Remove payload-content-type option from 'barbican secret get' command 4. Remove all code in the client that made the feature backwards compatible. 5. Rewrite failed tests to accommodate the new code change. 6. Update documentation to indicate the feature has been removed. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= No tests will need to be added but some will need to be changed. Documentation Impact ==================== The feature has already been marked as deprecated in the documentation http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-barbicanclient/usage.html#secret-content-types Other places will need to be updated such as CLI Usage. http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-barbicanclient/cli_usage.html#secrets References ==========

commit_message:
add keystone deadlines to schedule

we've communicated these dates in meetings, but it would be nice
to have it on a webpage.

Change-Id: I4caf1ddb0bf5cc501e9090b70146e3428f1cfbf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/74/267974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | | +---------------------------+-----------------------------+ | | | | :ref:`m-key-bp-freeze` || | | | :ref:`m-key-fpdeadline` | | | +---------------------------+-----------------------------+| | | :ref:`m-ff` | :ref:`m-key-ff` | Keystone -------- .. _m-key-bp-freeze: Keystone Spec/Blueprint Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The deadline for getting a Keystone blueprint approved for Mitaka is 3rd December 2015. Please note this is also the deadline to get any Mitaka keystone-specs merged. Specs that wish to land past this deadline must send an email to the dev mailing list asking for an exemption. .. _m-key-fpdeadline: Keystone Feature Proposal Deadline ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ All approved features must have a patch that shows most functionality ready for review by 18th January 2016. Approved features that do not have a patch ready for review by the deadline must send an email to the dev mailing list asking for an exemption. Approved features that miss the deadline or do not receive an exemption will be moved to the backlog or the first milestone of the next release. .. _m-key-ff: Keystone Feature Freeze ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The deadline for new features to merge is 29th February 2016. Feature that miss deadline will be moved to the backlog or the first milestone of the next release. Please note, the Keystone Feature Freeze date is aligned with :ref:`m-ff`.

commit_message:
Support Unicode request_id on Python 3

The oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
will change request_id type on Python 3 from bytes to str. This
change prepares Glance for this change.

Related-Bug: #1526662
Change-Id: Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9
(cherry picked from commit 1e316332889bcb46ce52b70603c1028f7614c2a0)

commit_message:
Adds security_group_updated method in HyperVSecurityGroupDriver

With the changes introduced in securitygroups_rpc with the
below commit hyperv code breaks.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147713/

Because of this, any changes in the security groups are not applied
by the HyperVSecurityGroupDriver because of a NotImplemented error.

Adds the security_group_updated method as noop in
HyperVSecurityGroupDriver, solving the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1512278

Change-Id: Ia5d6fca3c3a2f827ade850bb43fc7e434e934a22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/10/240810/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def security_group_updated(self, action_type, sec_group_ids, device_id=None): pass

subject: libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 21:08:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/586ab4629555f934808f49bb1aba0383e8e2fcb6', 'message': "libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Add a config option which will allow users to enable new, experimental,
or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

Change-Id: Ib8451241cc7674394939772bda442d7fc7097343
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-05 06:37:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/45ac5e58a88e0c39a62d70b40f952067a57f3e37', 'message': "libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Change-Id: Ib8451241cc7674394939772bda442d7fc7097343
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-06 13:19:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0ba5b6e6f7c0ed471b0e22e0f80cba68a2c17d4c', 'message': "libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Add a config option which will allow users to enable new, experimental,
or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

DocImpact

or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

commit_message:
libvirt: add live_migration_extra_flags config option

Add a config option which will allow users to enable new, experimental,
or optional migration flags without interfering with flags that should
be wholly controlled by the logic of the driver itself.

The flags which we consider under the driver's full control are:

  * LIVE - we don't allow disabling this, but we could add a config
    option for it if there was a known use case.

  * PEER2PEER, UNDEFINE_SOURCE, PERSIST_DEST - the driver is coded
    under specific assumptions about how these flags are used.

  * TUNNELLED - we now have a config option for tweaking this.

  * NON_SHARED_INC, NON_SHARED_DISK - these are mutually exclusive; we
    use the former and don't have a use case for the latter.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib8451241cc7674394939772bda442d7fc7097343
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix rgw_keystone_url for ceph-osd

When ceph-osd is installed on same node as radosgw, it reconfigures
rgw_keystone_url to public_ip:35357. Keystone doesn't listen on
public_ip:admin_port socket.

Closes-Bug: #1533578

Change-Id: I209d101f8ebf0a31119158fb6f37382ce8c6b4fe

commit_message:
remove use of virtualenv from release scripts

No longer rely on the release scripts to have a virtualenv or to set one
up. All of the tools will be installed globally, and libraries from
system packages, when we move to running these scripts on the secure
nodes in the CI system.

Change-Id: I30d430de9a690878950a8f8775b33ca7ba2896be

commit_message:
Adding cross-project spec team

As discussed in previous cross-project meetings, we need people that can
watch for comment and/or bring in knowledge from their respected teams
when a cross-project spec is being discussed. Otherwise we end up with
teams not knowing about multi-project wide specs.

Change-Id: I1dc1f553a6fcbea5db4c44f208d825fbee934bbe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-team-guide refs/changes/72/266072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ============================ Cross-Project Specifications ============================ In order to provide a consistent and deseriable experience for OpenStack end-users, it's necessary to have some concepts to be agreed across all the projects within the big tent. In addition, it helps future projects that want to be part of the big tent to have these guidelines for certain concepts (e.g. quotas, backwards compatibility). Cross-Project Specification Liaisons ==================================== The OpenStack project relies on the cross-project spec liaisons from each participating project to help with coordination and cross-project spec related tasks. The liaison defaults to the PTL, but the PTL can also delegate the responsibilites to someone else on the team by updating the liaison list on the CrossProjectLiaisons_ wiki page. Liaisons Responsibilities ------------------------- The liaison does not have to personally do all of these things, but must ensure they are done by someone on the project team. * Watching the `cross-project spec repo`_. * Comment on specs that involve your project. +1 to carry forward for TC approval. * If you're not able to provide technical guidance on certain specs for your project, it's up to you to get the right people involved. * Assuming you get someone else involved, it's up to you to make sure they keep up with communication. * Communicate back to your project's meeting on certain cross-project specs when necessary. This is also good for the previous bullet point of sourcing who would have technical knowledge for certain specs. * Attend the `cross-project meeting`_ when it's called for. * Work with the PTL of your project to begin prioritizing implementations of agreed specs from the community. .. _CrossProjectLiaisons: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CrossProjectLiaisons .. _cross-project spec repo: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/project:+openstack/openstack-specs+status:+open,n,z .. _cross-project meeting: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/CrossProjectMeeting

commit_message:
Supported resources list cli support

Currently there is no other way of getting list of supported
resource type than looking directly in the source codes.

This change set implements the CLI command 'resource list-types'
to list the resource type Gnocchi supports.

Change-Id: Id22209d8c515c2a97f8abf77380c656e2a52e088
Co-Authored-By: xialinjuan(ljxiash@cn.ibm.com)
Closes-bug: 1510024

pick a different previous version if the current version exists

If the version being released exists, look at the prior version so when
we produce the release notes and bug list we get the right commits.

added_lines: =========== Conventions =========== The OpenStack documentation uses several typesetting conventions. Notices ~~~~~~~ Notices take these forms: .. note:: A comment with additional information that explains a part of the text. .. important:: Something you must be aware of before proceeding. .. tip:: An extra but helpful piece of practical advice. .. caution:: Helpful information that prevents the user from making mistakes. .. warning:: Critical information about the risk of data loss or security issues. Command prompts ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console $ command Any user, including the ``root`` user, can run commands that are prefixed with the ``$`` prompt. .. code-block:: console # command The ``root`` user must run commands that are prefixed with the ``#`` prompt. You can also prefix these commands with the :command:`sudo` command, if available, to run them.

commit_message:
default to sending mail directly via lists.openstack.org

When the announce script runs on a CI node, we need to ensure the email
is sent before letting the job finish and destroying the node. Rather
than using an MTA on localhost, connect directly to lists.openstack.org
and push the mail there. That will block until the email is sent, at
which point it is safe for the job to exit.

Change-Id: I60be241402d6cc42f4219edec846a3c085019058

commit_message:
refactor script for commenting on launchpad bugs prior to move to project-config

When we move the release tagging scripts to the project-config
repository, they will need to have minimal dependencies and shouldn't
need to import other local modules. Move the launchpad code needed by
launchpad_add_comment.py into the file, and move the file out of the
cmds subdirectory to be a regular script instead.

Change-Id: Ie004c2a14100611d4b7c1604dcf7f465a6f0246c

commit_message:
refactor list_deliverable_changes.py prior to move to project-config

When we move the release tagging scripts to the project-config
repository, they will need to have minimal dependencies and shouldn't
need to import other local modules. Move the gitutils code needed by
list_deliverable_changes.py into the file, and move the file out of the
cmds subdirectory to be a regular script instead.

Change-Id: I7076d45be04366b95b3d662ffc181373339ad6c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/61/267161/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Lists the most recent versions in the deliverable files. """ from __future__ import print_function import argparse import os.path import subprocess import yaml def find_modified_deliverable_files(reporoot): "Return a list of files modified by the most recent commit." results = subprocess.check_output( ['git', 'diff', '--name-only', '--pretty=format:', 'HEAD^'], cwd=reporoot, ) filenames = [ l.strip() for l in results.splitlines() if l.startswith('deliverables/') ] return filenames def get_modified_deliverable_file_content(reporoot, filenames): """Return a sequence of tuples containing the new versions. Return tuples containing (deliverable name, series name, version number, list of repositories). """ # Determine which deliverable files to process by taking our # command line arguments or by scanning the git repository # for the most recent change. deliverable_files = filenames if not deliverable_files: deliverable_files = find_modified_deliverable_files( reporoot ) for basename in deliverable_files: filename = os.path.join(reporoot, basename) with open(filename, 'r') as f: deliverable_data = yaml.load(f.read()) # Determine where to send email announcements of # releases. Default to the development list, to cut down on # excessive emails to the announcement list. send_announcements_to = deliverable_data.get( 'send-announcements-to', 'openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org', ) # The series name is part of the filename, rather than the file # body. That causes release.sh to be called with series="_independent" # for release:independent projects, and release.sh to use master branch # to evaluate fixed bugs. series_name = os.path.basename( os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(filename)) ) deliverable_name = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(filename))[0] all_versions = { rel['version']: rel for rel in deliverable_data['releases'] } version = deliverable_data['releases'][-1]['version'] this_version = all_versions[version] for project in this_version['projects']: yield (deliverable_name, series_name, version, project['repo'], project['hash'], send_announcements_to) def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument( 'deliverable_file', nargs='*', help='paths to YAML files specifying releases', ) parser.add_argument( '--releases-repo', '-r', default='.', help='path to the releases repository for automatic scanning', ) args = parser.parse_args() results = get_modified_deliverable_file_content( args.releases_repo, args.deliverable_file, ) for r in results: print(' '.join(r)) return 0 if __name__ == '__main__': main()

added_lines: # # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Define: tripleo::ssl::nova_middleware_filter # # Define used add middleware to handle X-Forwarded-Proto header in the # pipeline for the Nova service. # # === Parameters: # # [*pipeline*] # The specific pipeline where the middleware will be introduced. # # [*paste_config*] # The path to the paste ini configuration file where the filters are defined. # # [*pipeline_ending*] # The ending part of the specific pipeline to be modified. # This is used in order to identify if the ssl middleware has already been # set. # # [*setting*] # (optional) The setting that contains the pipeline definition. # Defaults to 'keystone' # # [*after_filter*] # (optional) The specific filter after which the ssl middleware will be set. # Defaults to 'sizelimit' # define tripleo::ssl::nova_middleware_filter( $pipeline, $paste_config, $pipeline_ending, $setting = 'keystone', $after_filter = 'sizelimit', ) { if ! generate('/bin/bash', '-c', "/bin/grep -e '^${setting} .*ssl_header_handler.*${pipeline_ending}$' /etc/nova/api-paste.ini || true") { ini_subsetting { "nova_ssl_middleware_in_${pipeline}": ensure => present, path => $paste_config, section => $pipeline, setting => $setting, subsetting => $after_filter, value => ' ssl_header_handler', require => Package['nova-common'], } } }

added_lines: =========== Conventions =========== The OpenStack documentation uses several typesetting conventions. Notices ~~~~~~~ Notices take these forms: .. note:: A comment with additional information that explains a part of the text. .. important:: Something you must be aware of before proceeding. .. tip:: An extra but helpful piece of practical advice. .. caution:: Helpful information that prevents the user from making mistakes. .. warning:: Critical information about the risk of data loss or security issues. Command prompts ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console $ command Any user, including the ``root`` user, can run commands that are prefixed with the ``$`` prompt. .. code-block:: console # command The ``root`` user must run commands that are prefixed with the ``#`` prompt. You can also prefix these commands with the :command:`sudo` command, if available, to run them.

commit_message:
Enable ssl middleware for nova

This adds the needed middleware to handle the X-Forwarded-Proto for the
nova service. Specifically for the v2 and v2.1 APIs.

Change-Id: I58779290b8572bad1fafc41ce812447c4afe95ac
Depends-On: Iff914afe718bd0914d639337299589068c6dd237

added_lines: define tripleo::ssl_middleware_filter($package, $paste_config) { ini_setting { "${package}_ssl_middleware": ensure => present, path => $paste_config, section => 'filter:ssl_header_handler', setting => 'paste.filter_factory', value => 'oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory', require => Package[$package], } } define tripleo::nova_ssl_middleware($pipeline, $paste_config, $setting = 'keystone', $after_filter = 'sizelimit') { ini_subsetting { "nova_ssl_middleware_in_${pipeline}": ensure => present, path => $paste_config, section => $pipeline, setting => $setting, subsetting => $after_filter, value => ' ssl_header_handler', require => Package['nova-common'], } } ::tripleo::ssl_middleware_filter { 'set_nova_ssl_middleware': package => 'nova-common', paste_config => '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini', } # API v2 if ! generate('/bin/bash', '-c', "/bin/grep -e '^keystone.*ssl_header_handler.*keystonecontext osapi_compute_app_v21$' /etc/nova/api-paste.ini || true") { ::tripleo::nova_ssl_middleware { 'nova_ssl_middleware_in_v21_if': pipeline => 'composite:openstack_compute_api_v21', paste_config => '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini', } } # API v2.1 if ! generate('/bin/bash', '-c', "/bin/grep -e '^keystone.*ssl_header_handler.*legacy_v2_compatible osapi_compute_app_v21$' /etc/nova/api-paste.ini || true") { ::tripleo::nova_ssl_middleware { 'nova_ssl_middleware_in_v2_if': pipeline => 'composite:openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible', paste_config => '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini', } } if ! generate('/bin/bash', '-c', "/bin/grep -e '^pipeline.*ssl_header_handler.*computeversionapp$' /etc/nova/api-paste.ini || true") { ::tripleo::nova_ssl_middleware { 'nova_ssl_middleware_in_versions_if': pipeline => 'pipeline:oscomputeversions', paste_config => '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini', setting => 'pipeline', after_filter => 'faultwrap', } }

commit_message:
SSL/Nova: enable ssl_header_handler filter

Enable oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory in
ssl_header_handler middlewarefilter so we can run Nova API with SSL
support.

Change-Id: Iff914afe718bd0914d639337299589068c6dd237

added_lines: # # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Define: tripleo::ssl::middleware_filter # # Define used add middleware to handle X-Forwarded-Proto header in the # pipeline for the Nova service. # # === Parameters: # # [*pipeline*] # The specific pipeline where the middleware will be introduced. # # [*paste_config*] # The path to the paste ini configuration file where the filters are defined. # # [*pipeline_ending*] # The ending part of the specific pipeline to be modified. # This is used in order to identify if the ssl middleware has already been # set. # # [*setting*] # (optional) The setting that contains the pipeline definition. # Defaults to 'keystone' # # [*after_filter*] # (optional) The specific filter after which the ssl middleware will be set. # Defaults to 'sizelimit' # define tripleo::ssl::nova_ssl_middleware( $pipeline, $paste_config, $pipeline_ending, $setting = 'keystone', $after_filter = 'sizelimit', ) { if ! generate('/bin/bash', '-c', "/bin/grep -e '^${setting}.*ssl_header_handler.*${pipeline_ending}$' /etc/nova/api-paste.ini || true") { ini_subsetting { "nova_ssl_middleware_in_${pipeline}": ensure => present, path => $paste_config, section => $pipeline, setting => $setting, subsetting => $after_filter, value => ' ssl_header_handler', require => Package['nova-common'], } } }

commit_message:
Fix a bug error by passwords only includes numbers

When an IPMI password consists only of numbers, Ironic fails to create a
password file. From the format point of view, these passwords are
correct. These are that it is stored to the variable after being
converted to an int type, cause errors in the subsequent processing to
expect that it is a string type.

Change-Id: I85ee2e904fdb0d538f69c7dbfab4c81bb080b8cf
Closes-Bug: #1489234
(cherry picked from commit 93f99381acd727f539d3a78c0ae82b95860ba649)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/76/243876/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Map KSA exception to SDK exceptions

The use of KSA is an implementation detail. Users should not have to
know about KSA. Catch all KSA exceptions and map them to SDK
exceptions.

Change-Id: Ib873c038358fb318ae46e8bc5bd3b4dfb683daaa
Closes-Bug: #1526516
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/71/265071/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :class:`~keystoneauth1.session.Session` to provide end point filtering and mapping KSA exceptions to SDK exceptions.from functools import wrapsfrom types import FunctionType from keystoneauth1 import exceptions as _exceptionsfrom openstack import exceptions from six.moves.urllib import parsedef map_exceptions(func): @wraps(func) def map_exceptions_wrapper(*args, **kwargs): try: return func(*args, **kwargs) except _exceptions.HttpError as e: raise exceptions.HttpException(e.message, e.details, e.http_status) return map_exceptions_wrapper for attributeName, attribute in vars(_session.Session).items(): if isinstance(attribute, FunctionType) and \ not attributeName.startswith('_'): setattr(_session.Session, attributeName, map_exceptions(attribute)) def get_endpoint(self, auth=None, interface=None, **kwargs): """Override get endpoint to automate endpoint filtering"""

commit_message:
Adding devstack plugin for freezer gate job

Currently the plugin is moslty a copy of the
freeer-api plugin. At first instance we can enable
the gate and have the job executign without error,
after this we can commit new changes to execute
freezer specific tests. Anyway the freezer-api plugin
is most likley needed to execute the freezer-agent and
freezer-scheduler tests

Implements bp: freezer-dsvm
Depends-on: I837e3fe973d72c792cb34711cef9f6507a004d49

Change-Id: Iee995d5b32c17c4dbee5f5736b26bf3b9aa8ca14

commit_message:
Fix for vCenter OSTF with Neutron

Since in Fuel 8.0 nova-network was removed. Currently vCenter env
requires DVS or NSXv plugin as networking backend.

Change-Id: Ieb0884b936f249209074f08c2c919865f544e415
Closes-bug: #1529057

commit_message:
puppet: allow config of ad-hoc Keystone settings

Including ::keystone::config on the controller roles will allow
ad-hoc (non-puppet managed) settings to be made in the
keystone config file using Hiera.

Change-Id: Ib711f6baf22c63c234ac058d7da504ace9ebc628

Replace findall with search in uuid parsing function

Fuel-bootstrap list label could contain uuid which we do not need,
so taking only first matching part.

commit_message:
Implement a callback plugin for human readable ansible logs

This implements a callback plugin to make the ansible logs easier
to read. This is especially pertinent for the output of tasks
like shell commands and apt package actions.

It also disables the use of the verbose parameter for Ansible, as
this plugin outputs stdout/stderr anyway.

Change-Id: I56886ba1d7f99b861f625c68078583e82dae2988
(cherry picked from commit 775d256a4e6b163c78a838b7b95e9d3f3a8b5f61)

commit_message:
Move Neutron Types drivers under ML2 section

On wizard tab we have two neutron types drivers: VLAN and VXLAN (tun).
From UX side it's more logically to have it in ML2 core plugin section.
VXLAN is incompatible option for vmware.

Change-Id: I211c847c6fdd43d6706c905850b1097fdf332af8
Closes-Bug: #1526754

commit_message:
Default values for enabling services in ceilometer

The os_ceilometer role makes use of variables for each OpenStack service
to configure notification queue listeners. Include default values
for those variables in the role's default vars.

Change-Id: If30b5050f923e1cd0dbb004aaf7722c54b6de5d9
Closes-Bug: #1533801

subject: Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:51:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/6517a89e533a522b83b034b36bf696c733414de4', 'message': 'Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

TODO (in subsequent patches):
 - update the developer AIO docs

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-10 11:52:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/7a73d306ae8a577ce0b1586b718c5c1789df3f54', 'message': 'Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

commit_message:
Convert AIO bootstrap from bash to Ansible

This patch converts the AIO bootstrap process to use Ansible
instead of bash scripting. The patch also minimises the options
available to focus the role concerned to just handle an AIO
bootstrap, but gives it just enough flexibility to allow the
use of an external MongoDB database for Ceilometer/Aodh and
for a deployer to specify a secondary disk for the AIO to
consume.

A major change is that the AIO bootstrap process no longer
assumes that it can destroy a secondary boot device. It
requires a device name to be provided. This prevents horrible
surprises.

Backport Note:
While this backport respects the differences between the Master
branch and the Kilo branch, it also brings all the gating and
AIO related scripts into line with each other to ensure that all
methods and settings (where applicable) are the same.

The following differences from the Master patch are noted:
 - neutron_rpc_workers must be 0 for Kilo
 - nova_virt_type must be specifically configured for Kilo
 - the in-tree pip_install role is used (configured in
   tests/ansible.cfg) instead of the new independent role
 - All references to Aodh have been removed
 - The haproxy env.d related config task has been removed as
   this does not apply to Kilo
 - Change I98bcb478e99e11956618b2327399e18471aab534 is included
   (Add reliable OS detection for ansible bootstrap)
 - Change I31f63a2998080c6fedab3af7c2b1bb1a987d8c08 is included
   (Use pure variable name in $(()) statement)
 - Change If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f is included
   (Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script)
 - Change Iec03c768a9fadf82831af4b90db1907abd399966 is included
   (use fastest mirror available in OpenStack-CI)
 - Change I666f53e01066bf8bff4d28fa012eadae7c958116 is included
   (Bootstrap Host with updated CPU Map for OpenStack-CI)
 - Change Ic20ab65dc68a6f82eb5bf0751a968aa662b29eb5 is included
   (Make instance info output to stdout on failure)
 - Change I28af8a587bde629fd0c81a6c4ba47dd64c2e44db is included
   (Use Ansible AIO playbook for run-aio-build.sh)
 - Change I730c838a67ca03413fbdfa43ef7606d8cf2f9cd0 is included
   (Updating AIO docs for Ansible playbook)

Conflicts:
>------ansible-role-requirements.yml
>------scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh
>------scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
>------scripts/scripts-library.sh

Closes-Bug: #1522957
Implements: blueprint convert-aio-bootstrap-to-ansible
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: I6028952e7260388873f57db47cc3e08126ecc530
(cherry picked from commit 892c7fe46c68bc36e76f21a6b699349167534f46)

commit_message:
Remove redundant checking about request path

This patch is the follow-up of the previos refactoring[1], and
removes redundant checking about request path in object-server.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260337/

Change-Id: Ie4818a81a0aa31fd709c0e84b9d2d747429ccf51

commit_message:
[arch-design-draft] Reorganise operators requirements chapter

1. Split sections into separate files
2. Consolidate hardware content from the current guide
3. Consolidate software content from the current guide

Change-Id: I5edf204d88ea5622c656fe58699260e31fb9b7d3
Implements: blueprint arch-guide-mitaka-reorg
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/36/260336/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Quota management ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Quotas are used to set operational limits to prevent system capacities from being exhausted without notification. They are currently enforced at the tenant (or project) level rather than at the user level. Quotas are defined on a per-region basis. Operators can define identical quotas for tenants in each region of the cloud to provide a consistent experience, or even create a process for synchronizing allocated quotas across regions. It is important to note that only the operational limits imposed by the quotas will be aligned consumption of quotas by users will not be reflected between regions. For example, given a cloud with two regions, if the operator grants a user a quota of 25 instances in each region then that user may launch a total of 50 instances spread across both regions. They may not, however, launch more than 25 instances in any single region. For more information on managing quotas refer to the `Managing projects and users chapter <http://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ops/content/projects_users.html>`__ of the OpenStack Operators Guide.

commit_message:
Fixed validation logic of wizard panes

Validation of the wizard panes is moved to statics, the validation logic
is simplified and no longer requires pane render to detect pane errors

Closes-Bug: 1525950
Change-Id: I598e2551b613442c45c7f1522958703ad8ef193c

commit_message:
enable uefi boot

This patch enables uefi boot with the libvirt driver. This feature
is without some kind of functional testing and therefore
considered experimental.

Co-Authored-By: XinXiaohui <xiaohui.xin@intel.com>

Change-Id: I9d8b2896e4bd29f67ebab6ce1bc927aae271c3e7
Implements: blueprint boot-from-uefi

subject: Single point of entry for sample config generation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-04 21:59:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/opts.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/615ce9deeafc214bb42ee6009789c12fb90c8120', 'message': 'Single point of entry for sample config generation

To create a "nova.conf.sample" file, we use "tox -e genconfig". This
command triggers the generator from "oslo.config" which needs entry
points in "setup.cfg". Right now we have multiple entry points to
"opts.py" files which are going to be consolidated to one single point
of entry "nova/conf/opts.py". Until all config options are moved to that
central place, we would often face merge conflicts when multiple
contributors commit patches to that one "opts.py".

To prevent that, and to make it easier for future config option moduls
in "nova/conf/", the new "nova/conf/opts.py" module collects the config
options in a dynamic way.

This is copied from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260015/, but with
the older 2-tuple format of ("option list", [options]) replaced with a
dictionary with the option list name as the key. This is a much cleaner
way of representing the data, and less prone to errors, especially with
scripts that return options for multiple option lists.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: Ib43d3465c13b6813362a27d143822f18898893dc
'}]
commit_message:
Single point of entry for sample config generation

To create a "nova.conf.sample" file, we use "tox -e genconfig". This
command triggers the generator from "oslo.config" which needs entry
points in "setup.cfg". Right now we have multiple entry points to
"opts.py" files which are going to be consolidated to one single point
of entry "nova/conf/opts.py". Until all config options are moved to that
central place, we would often face merge conflicts when multiple
contributors commit patches to that one "opts.py".

To prevent that, and to make it easier for future config option moduls
in "nova/conf/", the new "nova/conf/opts.py" module collects the config
options in a dynamic way.

This is copied from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260015/, but with
the older 2-tuple format of ("option list", [options]) replaced with a
dictionary with the option list name as the key. This is a much cleaner
way of representing the data, and less prone to errors, especially with
scripts that return options for multiple option lists.

Blueprint centralize-config-options

Change-Id: Ib43d3465c13b6813362a27d143822f18898893dc

commit_message:
Python3: Keep compatibility for urllib.urlencode

In Python3, urlencode is not ins urllib module as it used to be in Python2.7.
To keep compatibility, use urllib.parse.urlencode instead of urllib.urlencode.

Targets blueprint: murano-python-3-support

Change-Id: I6c04049636bd1e853b87cd6913ac6adf002aa76f
